definitions.definition: To utter a sudden and loud cry , as in joy, triumph, exultation or anger, or to attract attention, to animate others, etc.
examples: Mom shouted to us to come sit at the table.

definitions.definition: To utter with a shout; to cry ; to shout out
examples: They shouted his name to get his attention.

definitions.definition: To forcefully attract attention or proclaim one’s presence .
To pay for food, drink or entertainment for others.
To post a text message (for example, email) in upper case , regarded as the electronic messaging equivalent of oral shouting.
examples: Please don't shout in the chat room.

definitions.definition: To treat with shouts or clamor .

main_definition: ( intransitive ) To utter a sudden and loud cry , as in joy, triumph, exultation or anger, or to attract attention, to animate others, etc.
secondary_definitions: ( transitive ) To utter with a shout; to cry ; to shout out
( intransitive , figuratively ) To forcefully attract attention or proclaim one’s presence .
( Australia , New Zealand , slang ) To pay for food, drink or entertainment for others.
( Internet ) To post a text message (for example, email) in upper case , regarded as the electronic messaging equivalent of oral shouting.
( transitive , obsolete ) To treat with shouts or clamor .
